alert.note: Alert for Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 12:27AM CDT until May 12 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL PITTSBURG COUNTY... At 1227 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Indianola to Alderson to near Blanco, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Mcalester... Krebs... Crowder... Alderson... Canadian... Indianola... Arrowhead State Park... Blanco... Pittsburg... Dow... Bache... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
